name: Instrument role
description: An Instrument role is a role an Instrument may act in.

cube_structure_item.description: Asset encumbrance residual maturity band divides the remaining maturity of the asset into the specific maturity band applicable to asset encumbrance reporting.
Asset encumbrance source indicator signals whether the liabity or off-balance sheet item is a source of encumbrance for an asset or not.
Available for encumbrance indicator distinguishes the asset into being available for asset encumbrance and not being available for asset encumbrance.
Date / period of application of forbearance measure
Reporting agent identifier

According to FinRep Annex 5: "the accumulated (...) total amount as at the reference date of principal and accrued past due interest and fees of any debt instrument that has been de-recognised to date (...) because the institution has no reasonable expectations of recovering the contractual cash flows."

An indicator to specify wheather an instrument is considered as debt financing according to Regulation (EU) 867/2016, allowed value for the data attribute purpose: "Financing of outstanding or maturing debt. This includes debt refinancing.".

Identification of the default status of the instrument or entity. Categories describing the situations in which an instrument or entity can be described as being at default in accordance with Article 178 of Regulation (EU) No 575/2013.
Derived default status is the default status where all specific statusses of default for the Financial asset instrument have been mapped to either "Default" or "Not in default".
Exposure with recourse indicator specifies if a Financial asset instrument is an instrument with or without recourse.

According to FinRep Annex 5: "the accumulated partial (...) amount as at the reference date of principal and accrued past due interest and fees of any debt instrument that has been de-recognised to date (...) because the institution has no reasonable expectations of recovering the contractual cash flows."
TYP_INSTRMNT_RL
A discriminator to distinguish between different types of Balance sheet recognised financial asset instruments by fair value.

Obtained collateral received instrument type distinguishes Collateral received instrument  whether it is a Collateral received instrument obtained by taking possession and Collateral received instrument that are not obtained.
Collateral instrument reuse indicator distinguishes between Collateral received instruments that are reused as Collateral given instruments and those that are not reused.
Identification of instruments in which the observed agent acts in its own name but on behalf of and with the risk borne by a third party.

Eligible as guarantee indicator distinguishes the Collateral received instrument data into those where the Collateral received instrument, which is a Credit Default Swap, is eligible to be the a guarantee, or is not eligible to be a guarantee.
Encumbered asset indicator
A discriminator to distinguish between financial assets that may potentially be classified as retail exposures and non-retail exposures.
A discriminator to distinguish between financial asset instruments with and without fixed interest rate.
A discriminator to distinguish between financial asset instruments with and without interest only.
A discriminator to distinguish between financial asset instruments with and without renegotiations.
A discriminator to distinguish between refinanced debt, instruments with modified interest rate below market value and other modified terms.

Level of fair value of a financial instruments according to the hierarchy defined in IFRS 13. Applicable to national GAAP based on BAD only if the allocation of instruments is measured at fair value according to different levels.
Defines the reason to irrevocably designate a non derivative financial instrument at fair value through profit or loss (use of fair value option). Is not applicable for nGAAP based on BAD.
A variable indicating the Non-current assets and instruments in disposal groups classified as held for sale in accordance with IFRS5. Is not applicable under national GAAP based on BAD.
Type of impairment recorded in accordance with the accounting standard – IFRS or national GAAP.

Initial imapirment status is the impairment status, recorded in the beginning of the financial year or at the initial recognition of the impairment of the exposure after the beginning of the financial year.
Frequency at which the interest rate is reset after the initial fixed-rate period, if any.
Low credit risk indicator for Finrep

Forbearance measures were granted in addition to already existing forbearance measures. It concerns forborne exposures under probation to which forbearance measures were applied in addition to forbearance measures granted at an earlier point in time, without the exposure having cured in between.
Non-performing forborne exposures that failed to meet the non-performing exit criteria.

An indicator specifying if an asset is classified as Non-performing forborne exposure under probation reclassified from non-performing or not according to Regulation (EU) 680/2014, Annex V, part 2.260.
A discriminator to distinguish between trading and banking (or non-trading) book.

An indicator specifying if an asset is classified as Non-performing forborne exposure under probation reclassified from non-performing or not according to Regulation (EU) 680/2014, Annex V, part 2.260.
Performing status in accordance with Implementing Regulation (EU) No 680/2014.
The reason for the choice of Performing status
Identification of project finance to identify in case of a project finance loan in accordance with Implementing Regulation (EU) No 680/2014.
Classification of instruments according to their purpose.
Past due financial instrument indicator distinguishes Financial instrument into whether or not its payments are being considered late, or past due.
Frequency of payments due, either of principal or interest, i.e. number of months between payments.
Balance sheet recognition of the financial asset.
Reference rate used for the calculation of the actual interest rate.
Subject to impairment indicator indicates whether the asset is subject to impairment or not.

Identification of subordinated debt. Subordinated debt instruments provide a subsidiary claim on the issuing institution that can only be exercised after all claims with a higher status (e.g. deposits/loans) have been satisfied.
A Time past due band distinguishes the debt into time brackets according to how much time passed between the date on which the payment was due and the reference date.
Time elapsed since initial recognition band classifies time elapsed since initial recognition in the balance sheet into bands used for FINREP reporting.
Transfer between impairment stages compares the impairment status at the beginning of the period (Initial impairment status) with the impairment status at the end of the period.
Type of amortisation of the instrument including principal and interest
Type of interest rate classifies credit exposures based on the base rate for establishing the interest rate for each payment period.
Amount of gains and losses from re-measurement of the asset accumulated from the initial recognition to the reference date.
Accumulated changes in fair value due to credit risk in accordance with Part 2.46 of Annex V to Implementing Regulation (EU) No 680/2014.

The amount of loss allowances that are held against or are allocated to the instrument on the reporting reference date. This data attribute applies to instruments subject to impairment under the applied accounting standard. Under IFRS, the accumulated impairment relates to the following
amounts:
(i) loss allowance at an amount equal to 12-month expected
credit losses;
(ii) loss allowance at an amount equal to lifetime expected
credit losses.
Under GAAP, the accumulated impairment relates to the following
amounts:
(i) loss allowance at an amount equal to general allowances;
(ii) loss allowance at an amount equal to specific allowances.
Accumulated negative value adjustments. Market risk induced
Accumulated negative value adjustments. Market risk induced

Cumulative amount of principal and past due interest of any debt instrument that the institution is no longer recognising because they are considered uncollectible, independently of the portfolio in which they were included. Write-offs could be caused both by reductions in the carrying amount of financial assets recognised directly in profit or loss and by reductions in the amounts of the allowance accounts for credit losses set off
against the carrying amount of financial assets.

The amount of accrued interest on loans at the reporting reference date as defined in Regulation (EU) No 1071/2013 (ECB/2013/33). In accordance with the general principle of accruals accounting, interest receivable on instruments should be subject to on-balance sheet recording as it accrues (i.e. on an accruals basis) rather than when it is actually received (i.e. on a cash basis).
Annualised agreed rate or narrowly defined interest rate in accordance with Regulation (EU) No 1072/2013 of the European Central Bank (ECB/2013/34).

Aggregate amount of principal, interest and any fee payment outstanding at the reporting date, which is contractually due and has not been paid (past due). This amount is always to be reported. '0' is to be reported if the instrument was not past due on the reporting date.
The total amount recovered since the date of default.

Observed agent's maximum exposure to credit risk on the inception date of the instrument, without taking into account any protection held or other credit enhancements. Total commitment amount on the inception date is established during the approval process and is intended to restrict an observed agent's amount of credit risk to a given counterparty for the relevant instrument.
The carrying amount in accordance with Annex V to Implementing Regulation (EU) No 680/2014.
The date on which the default status is considered to have arisen.

The date on which the interest-only period ends. Interest-only is an instrument for which, for a contractually set period, only the interest on the principal balance is paid, with the principal balance remaining unchanged.
The date on which forbearance measure have been applied.
The date on which a forbearance or renegotiation status as reported under 'status of forbearance and renegotiation' is considered to have occurred.
The date on which the current contractual relationship originated, i.e. the date on which the contract agreement became binding for all parties.
The date on which the non-performing status has been applied.

Next interest rate reset date is the date that the next interest rate reset, as defined in Part 3 of Annex I to Regulation (EU) No 1071/2013 (ECB/2013/33), takes place for the Serviced asset instrument. If the Serviced asset instrument is not subject to a future interest rate reset, its legal final maturity date will be reported.

The date on which the instrument became past due in accordance with Part 2.48 of Annex V to Implementing Regulation (EU) No 680/2014. This is the latest such date prior to the reporting reference date and it is to be reported if the instrument is past due on the reporting reference date.
The date on which the conditions specified in the contract are or can be executed for the first time, i.e. the date on which financial instruments are initially exchanged or created.

Number of times an exposure has been under forbearance measures. Exposures classified as forborne at the reporting reference date, to which forbearance measures have been applied at two, respectively more than two different points in time. That includes, among others, originally forborne exposures that exited the forborne status (cured forborne exposures), but were granted new forbearance measures after that.
The number of days (if any) for which the freezing period of the asset has been applied, in accordance with EBA guidelines 2016/07 paragraph 18.
Fair value as defined in IFRS 13.9.
Fair value changes

The difference between the outstanding nominal amount and the purchase price of the instrument at the purchase date. This amount should be reported for instruments purchased for an amount lower than the outstanding amount due to credit risk deterioration.

Changes in the fair value of an asset or liability, which is a hedged item and measured at amortised cost, that are recognised in the carrying amount due to the application of hedge accounting (IFRS 9.6)

Derecognised exposure gross carrying amount is an amount, that is the gross carrying amount of exposures that are derecognised on the balance sheet in exchange for Property, plant and equipment taken possession.
General allowances for bank risk affecting carrying amount (nGAAP)
General allowances for credit risk affecting carrying amount (nGAAP)
Gross carrying amount, as defined in IFRS 9 appendix A, excluding accrued interest

Haircut for trading position valued at fair value for the Balance sheet recognised financial asset instrument according to national general accepted accounting principles (nGAAP). 
According to Annex V (5.29):
Where applicable under national GAAP based on BAD, ‘Haircuts for trading positions valued at fair value’ shall be reported. The haircuts decrease the value of trading assets and increase the value of trading liabilities.
Maximum value for the interest rate charged.
Minimum value for the interest rate charged.
Margin or spread (expressed as a percentage) to add to the reference rate that is used for the calculation of the interest rate in basis points.
The amount of provisions for off-balance sheet amounts.
The start date of the period.
Taken into possession date is a date on which tthe Other non-financial asset taken into possession was taken into possession.
Accounting standard

An identifier applied by the reporting agent to uniquely identify each instrument under a single contract. Each instrument must have one instrument identifier. This value will not change over time and cannot be used as the instrument identifier for any other instrument under the same contract.
Accounting consolidation level is the level on which the accounting is consolidated, Solo or group.

Accounting portfolio where the instrument is recorded in accordance with the accounting standard – IFRS or national GAAP –under Regulation (EU) 2015/534 (ECB/2015/13) applied by the observed agent's legal entity.

Accumulated negative changes shall be the difference, at the level of the individual collateral item, between the value at initial recognition of the collateral and the carrying amount at the reporting reference date, where that difference is negative. (FINREP Annex V)

Reporting agents shall report credit data as recorded on the following reporting reference dates: (a) for monthly transmissions, on the last day of each month; (b) for quarterly transmissions, on the last day of March, June, September and December.
Gross carrying amount derived attribute
